You have $n$ potions lined up. Each potion has a value $a_i$ that represents how much your health will change when you drink it. You start with 0 health. You must walk through the potions from left to right, and at each potion, you can choose to drink it or not.  You can't drink a potion if it will make your health go below 0.

What is the maximum number of potions you can drink without your health ever becoming negative? 


Input:

* The first line contains an integer $n$ ($1 \leq n \leq 2000$) representing the number of potions.
* The next line contains $n$ integers $a_1$, $a_2$, ..., $a_n$ ($-10^9 \leq a_i \leq 10^9$) representing the health change for each potion.

Output:

* Output a single integer representing the maximum number of potions you can drink.
